T5

The T5 core module contains classes and functionality that support basic drawing operations and math that are used in managing and drawing the graphical and tiling interfaces that are provided in the Tile5 library.

Classes

  • T5.Vector
  • T5.Dimensions
  • T5.Rect

Submodules

  • T5.Settings
  • T5.V
  • T5.D
  • T5.R

T5.Vector

A vector is used to encapsulate X and Y coordinates for a point, and rather than bundle it with methods it has been kept to just core data to ensure it has a lightweight memory footprint.

Constructor

T5.Vector(x, y)

T5.XY

This module contains simple functions for creating and manipulating an object literal that contains an x and y value. Previously this functionaliy lived in the T5.V module but has been moved to communicate it's more generic implementation. The T5.V module still exists, however, and also exposes the functions of this module for the sake of backward compatibility.

add(xy*)

Return a new xy composite that is the value of all the xy values added together.

absSize(vector)

copy(src)

Return a new xy composite that is a copy of the one passed to the function

diff(pt1, pt2)

Return a point that is difference between the x and y values of xy1 and xy2.

distance(xy*)

Return the total euclidean distance between all the xy values passed to the function.

edges(points, count)

equals(pt1, pt2)

Return true if the two points are equal, false otherwise. NOTE: This function does not automatically floor the values so if the point values are floating point then floating point precision errors will likely occur.

extendBy(xy, theta, delta)

floor(pt*)

This function is used to take all the points in the array and convert them to integer values

getRect(xy*)

Get a T5.Rect that is large enough to contain the xy values passed to the function.

init(x, y)

Initialize a new point that can be used in Tile5. A point is simply an object literal with the attributes x and y. If initial values are passed through when creating the point these will be used, otherwise 0 values will be used.

invert(xy)

Return a new composite xy value that is the inverted value of the one passed to the function.

offset(xy, offsetX, offsetY)

Return a new composite xy which is offset by the specified amount.

simplify(xy*, generalization)

This function is used to simplify a xy array by removing what would be considered 'redundant' xy positions by elimitating at a similar position.

theta (xy1, xy2, distance)

toString(xy)

Return the string representation of the xy

T5.V

This module defines functions that are used to maintain T5.Vector objects and this is removed from the actual Vector class to keep the Vector object lightweight.

Functions

T5.Rect

A class used to store details pertaining to a rectangular region.

Constructor

new T5.Rect(x, y, width, height)

Properties

  • origin - the top left point of the rectangle
  • dimensions - the width and height of the rectangle
  • invalid - used to indicate that the rect dimensions are irrelevant

Notes

The invalid property was added and is used for assisting with managing the clip rect that will be drawn in a View. If marked invalid then detailed checking of the draw area is skipped, and no clip() will be applied when drawing the canvas (the whole thing is drawn).

T5.R

A module of utility functions for working with T5.Rect objects.

Functions

bottomRight(src)

Get the a T5.Vector for the bottom right position of the rect

empty()

Return a new empty T5.Rect

copy(src)

Return a new T5.Rect that is a copy of the specified src

getCenter(rect)

Return the a T5.Vector for the center of the specified rect

isEmpty(rect)

Return true if the rect has 0 width or 0 height.

union(dst, src)

This function takes the Rect values passed to the function and determines the required rect to contain all of those values. This origin and dimensions of this resulting Rect are then used to replace the first Rect passed to the function.

T5.Dimensions

T5.D

A module of utility functions for working with T5.Dimension objects

Functions

getAspectRatio(dimensions)

Return the aspect ratio for the dimensions (width / height)

getCenter(dimensions)

Get the a T5.Vector for the center of the dimensions (width / 2, height / 2)

getSize(dimensions)

Get the size for the diagonal for the dimensions
